body.description: Help your child wake up dry with the #1 NightTime Underwear*. GoodNites are 40% more absorbent vs. leading 4T-5T training pants, and they provide outstanding pajama protection to help your child rest easy. Bedwetting, or nocturnal enuresis, is common among children ages 4-12. Help him feel normal with GoodNites. These disposable bedwetting pants have 5 Layer Protection that absorbs and locks away wetness, with extra absorbency where he needs it most. GoodNites underwear also have Double Leg Barriers to help eliminate leaks and super-stretchy sides for a better fit for many body shapes and sizes. Unlike Pull-Ups, GoodNites absorbs odor for extra discretion and has an all around underwear-like fit. Plus, your child will feel more confident going to bed wearing trusted protection featuring cool camo or striped designs. GoodNites pants are available in three sizes: Extra Small for boys 28-45 lb., Small-Medium for boys 38-65 lb. and Large-Extra Large for boys 60-125+ lb. Stock up on GoodNites NightTime Underwear for less when you use free Subscribe & Save. For more ways to help your child rest easy, try GoodNites TRU-FIT Underwear and GoodNites Bed Mats. *Youth Pant Category

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Previous page Stay Dry Goodnites offer outstanding nighttime protection. It’s No Big Deal 1 in 6 kids aged 3-12 experience nocturnal enuresis; that’s 7 million kids in the U.S. alone. It Just Takes Time Nighttime wetting goes away with time, Goodnites is here to help kids wake up dry in the meantime. Bedwetting Happens If your child is dry during the day buy still wet at night, then it’s time to switch to Goodnites! Listening is Key Your child will have questions, and we’re here with answers. Check out our article section online! Next page 1 Stay Dry 2 It’s No Big Deal 3 It Just Takes Time 4 Bedwetting Happens 5 Listening is Key

What is bedwetting? Bedwetting is caused by delayed development in communication between the brain & bladder while a child is asleep. It typically goes away in time, as hormone levels adjust & the bladder grows. What are Goodnites? Goodnites are disposable nighttime underwear specifically designed to fit & provide protection for children who only wet at night. Goodnites even come in an XS size for children who are potty trained, but still experiencing nighttime wetness. Should you talk to your doctor about bedwetting? Yes, it’s important to speak with your child’s doctor & figure out the best management program for your family. Be sure to include your child, too. When kids hear they’re not alone, it instills confidence & understanding about the condition. Why should I choose Goodnites Nighttime Underwear instead of training pants? While Pull-Ups are ideal for potty training, Goodnites are best for nighttime protection. Our small sizes provide a better fit and offer 40% more protection that the leading training pants, so even when lying down kids are less likely to leak. What advice do you have for parents? Trust yourself and don’t put too much pressure on how you think it’s supposed to go. Every child is different. If your little one is still wet at night, just know you are not alone and it’s nothing to be embarrassed about - they will grow out of it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I honestly love these diapers they’re very absorbent can handle 2 full wettings wether standing sitting or lying down and #2 is almost unnoticeable unless checked due to the odor wicking I really wish they came in a larger size I’m starting to get a bit big for them so it makes it a bit uncomfortable when walking until it’s wet where then the sag stretches it out otherwise terrific diaper would 100% recommend
